resources.string: App info, help, user guide, etc.

Click to show or hide your page buttons.

Each one can be assigned to song actions such as metronome, transpose, pads, etc.
Long pressing on the main button lets you change the settings of each button.
Long pressing on some page buttons performs quick actions such as start/stop/edit
Change the appearance of the information in the actionbar
has been added to the end of your current set.
Number of key repeats required to emulate long press

Some pedals (such as AirTurn) send auto repeat key signals which stops the long press actions working. If you are using one of these pedals, switch on the AirTurn long press mode and adjust the slider to the number of repeated signals needed for a simulated long press action. Most keyboards have a delay of 500ms and a repeat rate of about 25ms. This means that holding down a key for 1 second will record 20 key presses. AirTurn pedals allow you to adjust the repeat rate and delay time using their companion app. Higher numbers for the key repeat count mean holding the pedal for longer to register as a long press.
The app will make the text as large as possible to fit the screen

DO DO#/REb RE RE#/MIb MI FA FA#/SOLb SOL SOL#/LAb LA LA#/SIb SI

You can filter sections by using prefixes. If you add the filter \'guitar\', any sections using this prefix would be filtered. e.g. [*guitar:Instrumental]
By default filtered sections are hidden, but you can set this to only show these filtered sections instead

Set up foot pedal buttons and actions
Click on a pedal button below to assign it to a keyboard button or midi note and assign actions to it. Most Bluetooth pedals send keyboard commands (e.g. arrow up/down).
To use a midi pedal, make sure you have connected it using the midi settings in the app first.

You haven\'t backed up your song library in the last 10 times you have used this app. This is highly recommended as you can recover your songs if anything goes wrong. Ideally you should keep a copy of your backup file on the cloud (e.g. Google Drive) or email it to yourself.

Your current OpenSong/Songs folder directory structure is shown below.
Click on the OpenSong (ROOT) folder to change your storage location.
Click on the Songs (MAIN) folder to create a backup or a sub directory.
If you already have sub directories, clicking on them will give further options.

Please select your \'OpenSong\' folder. This where songs, sets and more are stored. If you need a new folder simply select a location for one to be added. You can change this at any time from the Options menu. Internal storage is recommended.\nFor an update or re-install: You can use the yellow button (not available in Android 11+) to find any previous \'OpenSong\' folder.
This is where your songs are normally stored (often called the MAIN folder). You can optionally set up subdirectories to better manage your song library.

When selecting an OpenSong folder location:
SELECT ONLY INTERNAL OR SD CARD storage.
Internal storage is recommended. This may list as device storage or with your device's name.
When selecting you may need to change settings to show all storage.
On Android 10+ you should not select the Downloads or Root folder. If in doubt, choose the 'Documents' folder.
Access to your storage is required to read and write songs and sets.
Click here to change your storage location (where the root OpenSong folder is located).
Manage your storage location and song folders
"Please do not select the \'Songs\' folder as your storage location. You should select the parent \'OpenSong\' folder location instead."
Adjust gestures to move between songs

Gets rid of blank lines after each section to maximise text size

"[Intro] Welcome to OpenSongApp! This is an information page to show you some of the features of the app. OpenSongApp has many more features across three modes: • Performance Mode – use your Android device as a song book on stage • Stage Mode – control stage display monitors or hook up to a projector • Presentation Mode – hook up to a projector and display lyrics
[Menus] The left hand slide out song and set menu: • Show all songs and folders on the device • Allows searching and filtering of songs • Show the current editable set
The settings menu: all options/settings. The page buttons let you access special song features: backing track, auto scroll, metronome, chords, notes, links, and more!
[Get help with all of the cool features…] To find out all of the app features, please check out the online help pages Use \'Help (Online)\' in the options menu under the \'Other\' category to visit http://www.opensongapp.com
[Adding songs] You can manually create any song you like. The app only comes with this \'song\' by default due to copyright. You can start a song by import from other services: • Desktop OpenSong – I highly recommend syncing using Dropbox • ChordPro files • Ultimate Guitar website (using the import feature) • Chordie website (using the import feature) • SongSelect .usr files • some iOS app song files and then edit it to get your OpenSong version. Use \'Find new songs\' in the options menu.
Songs are stored on your device in OpenSong format (XML files without the .xml etension) in the /OpenSong/Songs folder. This folder is the storage location you chose when you first ran the app. Check out the \'Storage\' category of the options menu to see where this is.
[Edit the song] Click on the song title in the menu to preview it. This also allows you to quickly edit the song.
[Chords at work] This song has been set as having a key of G. .G D Em C G G7 Chord lines (above) start with a full stop/period (.) You can set capo display and transpose the chords easily, this is done from the \'Chords\' category in the options menu. Nashville, European and Do Ré Mi chords are understood.
[Scaling] By default OpenSongApp scales to song width. You can change the \'Display\' \'Autoscale\' options in the options menu.
[Sets] Add songs to sets using the song/sets menu.
[Customising] You can customise themes, fonts, pedals, etc. These customisations can be saved as profiles.\n\n Check out the categories in the right hand options menu. ; HERE IS AN EXAMPLE OF A SONG Edit this song and look at \'Lyrics\' to see how it was done!
[Intro] .||: G | D/F# | Em7 | D :|| [V1] .G2 D/F# Love everlasting, love without measure .Em7 D Full of compassion, righteous and pure .C G/B Am7 C/D D Is my Saviour\'s love, is my Father\'s heart [V2] .G2 D/F# Loved by the Father, saved by the Son .Em7 D Born of His Spirit, washed in the blood .C G/B Am7 C/D D This is my Saviour\'s love, this is my Father\'s heart
[B] .Em Cmaj7 Em Cmaj7 Your love for me, ___it reaches to the heavens .Em Cmaj7 Bm7 Let my love for You __just grow and grow! .Em Cmaj7 Em Cmaj7 Your love for me, ___it reaches to the heavens .Em Cmaj7 D D/F# Let my love for You __just grow and grow! [V3] .G2 D/F# Love sent from heaven, received in our hearts .Em7 D Loving each other, since Christ first loved us .C G/B Am7 C/D D Sharing my Saviour\'s love, showing my Father\'s heart
[Outro] ;(Slow to end) .| G |"

"This page allows you to assign buttons from a page turning device (such as a bluetooth footswitch) to control moving through sets or scrolling up and down on a song page.

You must ensure that the device is already connected to your Android tablet and switched on.

Click on the green or blue buttons below then press the desired control button on your footswitch, etc."

[V] = Verse, [V1] = Verse 1, [C] = Chorus, [C1] for Chorus 1, [P] = Prechorus, [T] = Tag, [B] = Bridge, […(whatever you want)…] = Custom tag.\n Lyric lines start with a space, chord lines with a full stop, comment lines with a semicolon.

"If you have issues connecting devices, try changing the connection mode. Older versions of the app (where there was no option to change the mode) used cluster mode by default. All connecting devices need to be set to the same mode."
